tuv.seg: Who can be forced to be a witness?
Cé na daoine gur féidir iallach a chur orthu a bheith ina bhfinnéithe?
The general rule is that anyone who is competent can be compelled (forced) to give evidence in a criminal or civil case
Mar riail ghinearálta is féidir iallach a chur ar gach duine inniúil a bheith ina f(h)inné i gcás choiriúil nó sibhialta
There are a number of circumstances, however, where you cannot be forced to attend and give evidence
Ach, tá eisceachtaí faoi leith a bhaineann leis an riail seo
If you are the accused in a criminal case you do not have to give evidence in your own defence
Ní féidir iallach a chur ar an gcúisí fianaise chosanta a thabhairt ar a s(h)on féin
If you decide not to give evidence in the case, that fact cannot be commented upon by the prosecution to the jury
Má dhéanann cúisí cinneadh gan fianaise a thabhairt sa chás ní féidir leis na cúisitheoirí é sin a rá leis an ngiúiré
If you do opt to give evidence in your trial, you may then be cross-examined by the prosecution and you cannot refuse to answer any question on the grounds that it may incriminate you

Má roghnaíonn an cúisí fianaise a thabhairt sa triail, is féidir ansin leis na cúisitheoirí cros-cheistiú a chur air/uirthi agus ní féidir leis/léi diúltú aon cheisteanna a fhreagairt ar fhaitíos go mbeadh sé/sí dhá f(h)éinchiontú
However, the prosecution may not ask you questions about your previous bad character unless you have:
Ach, ní féidir leis na cúisitheoirí aon cheisteanna a chur ar an gcúisí a bhaineann lena d(h)roch cháil san am atá caite ach amháin sa chás go bhfuil
• Questioned the character of any prosecution witness or
• fianaise tugtha aige/aici a bhaineann lena d(h)ea-cháil féin nó
• Given evidence in your own defence against a co-accused
• cáil aon fhinné a bhaineann leis na cúisitheoirí ceistnithe aige/aici nó
You cannot be forced to give evidence by the prosecution in their efforts to convict you
• fianaise tugtha ar mhaithe lena c(h)osaint féin i gcoinne comh-chúisí

Under Part 4 of the Criminal Evidence Act 1992, if you are the spouse of the accused you are competent to give evidence for either the defence or the prosecution (unless you happen to be a co-accused)
Tá céile an chúisí inniúil le fianaise a thabhairt ar son na gcosantóirí nó na gcúisitheoirí (ach amháin sa chás gur comh-chúisí é/í an céile)
However, you may only be compelled or forced to testify for the prosecution against the accused if:
Ach, d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh iallach curtha air/uirthi fianaise a thabhairt ar son na gcúisitheoirí sa chás amháin:
• The offence in question is of violence or the threat of violence to you, your child or the accused’s child, or a person under 17 (includes an adopted child)
• go mbaineann an choir le foréigean i gcoinne an chéile, linbh an chéile nó duine eile atá faoi sheacht mbliana déag d’aois
• The offence is a sexual offence in relation to your child, the accused’s child or a person under 17 (includes an adopted child)
• gur coir ghnéis atá i gceist i gcoinne linbh an chéile nó i gcoinne duine atá faoi sheacht mbliana déag d'aois
• The offence consists of attempting or conspiring to commit or of aiding, abetting, counselling, procuring or inciting commission of either of the above two offences

• go bhfuil iarracht i gceist ceachtar den dá choir thuasluaite a dhéanamh nó comhcheilg a imirt, cabhrú agus neartú, comhairle a chur ar dhuine, soláthar a dhéanamh nó duine a spreagadh i dtaobh na gcoireanna sin
A former spouse is a person who has either got a decree of divorce or judicial separation or who has a separation agreement with the accused
Áirítear mar iarchéilí duine a bhfuil ordú colscartha nó scaradh dlíthiúil nó comhaontú scartha aige leis an gcúisí
If you are a former spouse you are considered competent and may be forced to testify for the defence or the prosecution
Tá iarchéile inniúil le fianaise a thabhairt agus d'fhéadfaí iallach a chur air/uirthi fianaise a thabhairt ar son na gcosantóirí nó na gcúisitheoirí
However, you cannot be compelled or forced to give evidence against the accused in relation to offences committed while the marriage was still ongoing unless:
Ach, ní féidir iallach ar chur ar iarchéile fianaise a thabhairt i gcoinne an chúisí a bhaineann le coireanna a rinneadh nuair a bhí an pósadh bailí ach amháin sa chás:
• The offence in question is of violence or the threat of violence to you, your child or the accused’s child, or a person under 17 (includes an adopted child)
• go mbaineann an choir le foréigean i gcoinne an chéile, linbh an chéile nó duine eile atá faoi sheacht mbliana déag d'aois
• The offence is a sexual offence in relation to your child, the accused’s child or a person under 17 (includes an adopted child)
• gur coir ghnéis atá i gceist i gcoinne linbh an chéile nó i gcoinne duine atá faoi sheacht mbliana déag d'aois
• The offence consists of attempting or conspiring to commit or of aiding, abetting, counselling, procuring or inciting commission of either of the above two offences

go bhfuil iarracht i gceist ceachtar den dá choir thuasluaite a dhéanamh nó comhcheilg a imirt, cabhrú agus neartú, comhairle a chur ar dhuine, soláthar a dhéanamh nó duine a spreagadh i dtaobh na gcoireanna sin
Diplomatic agents are competent and may give evidence, but they are not obliged to give evidence as witnesses in either criminal or civil proceedings
Tá oifigigh thaidhleoireachta inniúil agus is féidir leo fianaise a thabhairt, ach níl aon iallach orthu fianaise a thabhairt mar fhinnéithe in imeachtaí coiriúla ná sibhialta
This means that they cannot be compelled or forced to give evidence in any case
Mar sin ní féidir iallach a chur orthu fianaise a thabhairt in aon chás
For more detailed information you should seek legal advice
Ba chóir duit comhairle dlí a lorg chun faisnéis mionsonraithe a fháil
